intro: Tabernaemontana donnell-smithii, commonly known as the Hawaiian star jasmine, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its fragrant, star-shaped white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth texture, while its bark is smooth and grayish in color. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in coastal and lowland areas.
